blog.name: queen-scribbles
blog.title: Patron Saint of Snark
blog.description:
Hi, I'm Cait. I write. Geek trash.  Lots of BioWare(mostly Dragon Age and SWtOR), Pillars of Eternity, LOTRO, and Critical Role. Proud member of the Sebastian Vael and Carver Hawke defense squads. They will show up a lot. You have been warned. ;P 
Mobile header credit to drathe, and icon/sidebar credit to tumbluberry.

summary: It’s some kind of something watching the end bit of Search for Bob the same day as listening to Vax and Keyleth’s conversation...
body: It’s some kind of something watching the end bit of Search for Bob the same day as listening to Vax and Keyleth’s conversation in Ep 45(Those Who Walk Away). Yknow, the one about how she’s scared even if they beat the Chroma Conclave, she might still lose him. 😀That conversation 😀 Yeah, I’m totally fine and not fucked up at all. 😀😀😀

reblog.comment: It’s some kind of something watching the end bit of Search for Bob the same day as listening to Vax and Keyleth’s conversation in Ep 45(Those Who Walk Away). summary: mighty nein but college/human au :’’) (from first to last they are: Caleb (holding Frumpkin), Nott, Jester, Fjord, Beau, Molly...
caption:
mighty nein but college/human au :’’)

(from first to last they are: Caleb (holding Frumpkin), Nott, Jester, Fjord, Beau, Molly and Yasha !!) 

headcanons for each character beneath the cut !!

Caleb:

He’s always reading and taking notes. he’s autistic and his special interests are history, ancient/dead languages and paganism. Frumpkin is a big comfort to him..and also he wears the same jumper n coat every single day, not matter the weather. Also he is gay n he/him.

Nott:

Regularly shoplifts and steals people’s food and pens (also eats food off the ground). She has been arrested before..probably for dumpster diving. She has many collections and picks up anything shiny. She’s very anxious and self medicates with alcohol. she doesnt care about gender and uses and pronouns and is aro/ace.

Jester:

She makes and modifies her clothes with cheap fabric and other remnants. She makes polymer clay jewellery of like,, cakes and lollipops. Also she makes photoalbums and scrapbooks and carries her sketchbook everywhere. She uses sparkly toothpaste and has like 5 fillings bc of her sweet-tooth. Also, she gives interesting advice… and she is chaotic bi. 

Fjord:

He’s the only one who can drive out of the entire group. And he protects all his friends and he likes swimming. He’s bi n he/him.

Beau:

She only wears sports clothes and no one has eveer seen her in a skirt. Loves martial arts (and does regular cardio n weight training). And strangers think she’s mean..she isn’t really..just a bit prickly. She’ll fight you over videogames if she loses. Also she wants to impress Yasha but doesnt rly know how. She is she/her and a disaster gay.

Molly:

They practice blood magick and they’ll tell your future with tarot. They give stern but good advice. And has a jewellery and makeup collection and wears fake designer clothes and anything gaudy. They drink iced tea.. Also theyre genderfluid (any pronouns) and pan!

Yasha:

Sometimes just doesnt show up to class for a few days.. and doesnt like groups of people or crowded places. She’s autistic and talking to people is,, hard. She’s pagan and worships storms. Her and Molly have performed rituals together. And she collects all the flowers and presses them and hangs them to dry…Probly listens to Wardruna, Eivør, Sigur Rós and Sóley. Soft but will beat you up if needed. She isnt sure about gender, hasnt decided yet.

mighty nein but college/human au :’’)

(from first to last they are: Caleb (holding Frumpkin), Nott, Jester, Fjord, Beau, Molly and Yasha !!) 

headcanons for each character beneath the cut !!

blog.name: disasterhumans
blog.title: #TeamHuman
blog.description: A Critical Role sideblog (with dashes of TAZ and general D&D). [Read | 24 | ze/zir | bi, black and gender weird].

tags: i can't wait until we finally get caleb getting aggressively protective over beau during her backstory
writing these up has made me realize that my memory of episodes 43-49 is very jumbled
summary: okay, i’ll bite since i love them so much and your insight is always fantastic. top five empire kids/team human moments?
question: okay, i’ll bite since i love them so much and your insight is always fantastic. top five empire kids/team human moments?
answer:
fuck fuck fuck, you called my bluff—now I have to pick. 

+Bonus for all of their smaller moments. For all the awkward hugs. For the moments before they were really close that hinted at their solidarity to come. Caleb constantly making sure they both had light. Caleb calling Beau a nerd. Beau letting Caleb use her to steady himself when he goes into Frumpkin-vision. Sharing berries and whiskey and talking about the afterlife. Leaning against each other after a hard fight. Just…every single littler interaction they ever have together.

5. Okay, look, Bowlgate was a legitimately fascinating character moment between the two of them, and revealed a lot about where both Caleb and Beau are coming from. We learned a lot about the kinds of things Caleb will go into a moral panic over, and the types of things that push Beau’s specific buttons. This moment—perhaps more so than even Caleb’s backstory reveal—was also a crucial turning point in their relationship with each other. Their relationship is so much of a push-pull. They’re never immediately on the same page, and this huge, glaring moment of them being not only on utterly different pages, but also in wildly different books provided the perfect opportunity for the two of them to work out how to bridge that gap of difference between them. Especially because they really are quite similar to each other. 

4. We haven’t necessarily gotten a specific callback to it in a while, but the pact that Beau and Caleb made to keep each other on track was a very important moment in the two of them really dedicating themselves their odd little fledgling friendship. And even if they don’t cite the pact they made, it’s there in so many of their interactions—especially more recent ones. Caleb is constantly appealing to Beau for her support on his plan to bring down the Assembly in no small part, I think, because they’ve already established this link together. He doesn’t really specifically appeal to the others to back his plays in this same way that he does with Beau. The two of them both struggle—in different ways—with how to “be people.” And while they have the others to ask for advice, they get a lot of their practical application of said advice, with each other. They’ve both learned a lot from each other through the act of pushing one another.

3. Beau softly, gently, without comment, resting her hand on Caleb’s shoulder as he shares his backstory in episode 49. Caleb desperately reaching out for Beau. Beau resting her hand back on top of his. Just…there’s so much tenderness between them. Hard won in so many different ways. And in that moment she is just completely, and unequivocally there for him. And all of that immediately coming on the heels of…

2. Their argument in episode 48 It was so exemplary of all the things that are perfect and hard about their dynamic. Beau doesn’t quite understand enough what Caleb’s anxieties and triggers are regarding Yussah, but she thinks she’s done this really nice thing for him, and is so, so disappointed and confused when instead of being met with excitement, she is rebuffed. Beau misinterpreting Caleb’s fears and thinking that he doubts the Nein’s likeliness to go to bat for him when, in fact, that’s exactly what he’s afraid of. He literally just had a mage that reminds him of Trent tell him to use his friends to save his own hide and not a few hours later Beau offers up that very thing. Caleb muttering “the problem with friends is that you have to care for them.” Caleb admitting to caring about her and the Nein! Calling them friends! Sure, he walks away right after, but that’s still so big, for him to actually vocalize that sentiment. Beau yelling after him. “YOU’RE COOL, CALEB. SEE! JESTER THINKS YOU’RE FUCKING COOL! BECAUSE SHE’S YOUR FUCKING FRIEND!” Caleb yelling at a tree. Honestly every about that scene was delightful.

1. Their conversation in episode 57. Caleb telling Beau, directly, that he needs her to be his friend. Just…Caleb reaching out and recognizing that, yeah, these people really do care about him, and that he’s come to rely on it to some extent. Beau telling him that her being his friend has never been in question. Telling him that what’s always been unclear to her, even now, is whether or not Caleb understands that. It’s not even that Beau is exactly unclear that Caleb returns the sentiment. It’s that she doesn’t know if Caleb really understands that he has people to support him, and who have his back, and she’s scared about what it might mean if he doesn’t realize that, at this point. Beau telling Caleb that “doing good” is the best retribution for him (and the fact that she knows not to frame it as “redemption”). Beau asking Caleb to trust himself. Caleb saying he’s trying (like, that is SO HUGE, that is so much bigger a step in moving forward than we’d really seen up to this point). Their hug!! At the end!! Which was only, like 20% awkward. Just!!! God!! More Team Human cuddles immediately, please. And, of course: Hollaaaaa

reblog.comment:

Beau doesn’t quite understand enough what Caleb’s anxieties and triggers are regarding Yussah, but she thinks she’s done this really nice thing for him, and is so, so disappointed and confused when instead of being met with excitement, she is rebuffed. Beau misinterpreting Caleb’s fears and thinking that he doubts the Nein’s likeliness to go to bat for him when, in fact, that’s exactly what he’s afraid of. He literally just had a mage that reminds him of Trent tell him to use his friends to save his own hide and not a few hours later Beau offers up that very thing. Caleb muttering “the problem with friends is that you have to care for them.” Caleb admitting to caring about her and the Nein! Calling them friends! Sure, he walks away right after, but that’s still so big, for him to actually vocalize that sentiment. Beau yelling after him. “YOU’RE COOL, CALEB. SEE! JESTER THINKS YOU’RE FUCKING COOL! BECAUSE SHE’S YOUR FUCKING FRIEND!” Caleb yelling at a tree. Honestly every about that scene was delightful.

1. Their conversation in episode 57. Caleb telling Beau, directly, that he needs her to be his friend. Just…Caleb reaching out and recognizing that, yeah, these people really do care about him, and that he’s come to rely on it to some extent. Beau telling him that her being his friend has never been in question. Telling him that what’s always been unclear to her, even now, is whether or not Caleb understands that. It’s not even that Beau is exactly unclear that Caleb returns the sentiment. It’s that she doesn’t know if Caleb really understands that he has people to support him, and who have his back, and she’s scared about what it might mean if he doesn’t realize that, at this point. Beau telling Caleb that “doing good” is the best retribution for him (and the fact that she knows not to frame it as “redemption”). Beau asking Caleb to trust himself. Caleb saying he’s trying (like, that is SO HUGE, that is so much bigger a step in moving forward than we’d really seen up to this point). Their hug!! At the end!! Which was only, like 20% awkward. Just!!! God!! More Team Human cuddles immediately, please. And, of course: Hollaaaaa

trail.content_raw:
fuck fuck fuck, you called my bluff—now I have to pick. 

+Bonus for all of their smaller moments. For all the awkward hugs. For the moments before they were really close that hinted at their solidarity to come. Caleb constantly making sure they both had light. Caleb calling Beau a nerd. Beau letting Caleb use her to steady himself when he goes into Frumpkin-vision. Sharing berries and whiskey and talking about the afterlife. Leaning against each other after a hard fight. Just…every single littler interaction they ever have together.

5. Okay, look, Bowlgate was a legitimately fascinating character moment between the two of them, and revealed a lot about where both Caleb and Beau are coming from. We learned a lot about the kinds of things Caleb will go into a moral panic over, and the types of things that push Beau’s specific buttons. This moment—perhaps more so than even Caleb’s backstory reveal—was also a crucial turning point in their relationship with each other. Their relationship is so much of a push-pull. They’re never immediately on the same page, and this huge, glaring moment of them being not only on utterly different pages, but also in wildly different books provided the perfect opportunity for the two of them to work out how to bridge that gap of difference between them. Especially because they really are quite similar to each other. 

4. We haven’t necessarily gotten a specific callback to it in a while, but the pact that Beau and Caleb made to keep each other on track was a very important moment in the two of them really dedicating themselves their odd little fledgling friendship. And even if they don’t cite the pact they made, it’s there in so many of their interactions—especially more recent ones. Caleb is constantly appealing to Beau for her support on his plan to bring down the Assembly in no small part, I think, because they’ve already established this link together. He doesn’t really specifically appeal to the others to back his plays in this same way that he does with Beau. The two of them both struggle—in different ways—with how to “be people.” And while they have the others to ask for advice, they get a lot of their practical application of said advice, with each other. They’ve both learned a lot from each other through the act of pushing one another.

3. Beau softly, gently, without comment, resting her hand on Caleb’s shoulder as he shares his backstory in episode 49. Caleb desperately reaching out for Beau. Beau resting her hand back on top of his. Just…there’s so much tenderness between them. Hard won in so many different ways. And in that moment she is just completely, and unequivocally there for him. And all of that immediately coming on the heels of…

2. Their argument in episode 48 It was so exemplary of all the things that are perfect and hard about their dynamic. Beau doesn’t quite understand enough what Caleb’s anxieties and triggers are regarding Yussah, but she thinks she’s done this really nice thing for him, and is so, so disappointed and confused when instead of being met with excitement, she is rebuffed. Beau misinterpreting Caleb’s fears and thinking that he doubts the Nein’s likeliness to go to bat for him when, in fact, that’s exactly what he’s afraid of. He literally just had a mage that reminds him of Trent tell him to use his friends to save his own hide and not a few hours later Beau offers up that very thing. Caleb muttering “the problem with friends is that you have to care for them.” Caleb admitting to caring about her and the Nein! Calling them friends! Sure, he walks away right after, but that’s still so big, for him to actually vocalize that sentiment. Beau yelling after him. “YOU’RE COOL, CALEB. SEE! JESTER THINKS YOU’RE FUCKING COOL! BECAUSE SHE’S YOUR FUCKING FRIEND!” Caleb yelling at a tree. Honestly every about that scene was delightful.

1. Their conversation in episode 57. Caleb telling Beau, directly, that he needs her to be his friend. Just…Caleb reaching out and recognizing that, yeah, these people really do care about him, and that he’s come to rely on it to some extent. Beau telling him that her being his friend has never been in question. Telling him that what’s always been unclear to her, even now, is whether or not Caleb understands that. It’s not even that Beau is exactly unclear that Caleb returns the sentiment. It’s that she doesn’t know if Caleb really understands that he has people to support him, and who have his back, and she’s scared about what it might mean if he doesn’t realize that, at this point. Beau telling Caleb that “doing good” is the best retribution for him (and the fact that she knows not to frame it as “redemption”). Beau asking Caleb to trust himself. Caleb saying he’s trying (like, that is SO HUGE, that is so much bigger a step in moving forward than we’d really seen up to this point). Their hug!! At the end!! Which was only, like 20% awkward. Just!!! God!! More Team Human cuddles immediately, please. And, of course: Hollaaaaa
trail.content:
fuck fuck fuck, you called my bluff—now I have to pick. 

+Bonus for all of their smaller moments. For all the awkward hugs. For the moments before they were really close that hinted at their solidarity to come. Caleb constantly making sure they both had light. Caleb calling Beau a nerd. Beau letting Caleb use her to steady himself when he goes into Frumpkin-vision. Sharing berries and whiskey and talking about the afterlife. Leaning against each other after a hard fight. Just…every single littler interaction they ever have together.

5. Okay, look, Bowlgate was a legitimately fascinating character moment between the two of them, and revealed a lot about where both Caleb and Beau are coming from. We learned a lot about the kinds of things Caleb will go into a moral panic over, and the types of things that push Beau’s specific buttons. This moment—perhaps more so than even Caleb’s backstory reveal—was also a crucial turning point in their relationship with each other. Their relationship is so much of a push-pull. They’re never immediately on the same page, and this huge, glaring moment of them being not only on utterly different pages, but also in wildly different books provided the perfect opportunity for the two of them to work out how to bridge that gap of difference between them. Especially because they really are quite similar to each other. 

4. We haven’t necessarily gotten a specific callback to it in a while, but the pact that Beau and Caleb made to keep each other on track was a very important moment in the two of them really dedicating themselves their odd little fledgling friendship. And even if they don’t cite the pact they made, it’s there in so many of their interactions—especially more recent ones. Caleb is constantly appealing to Beau for her support on his plan to bring down the Assembly in no small part, I think, because they’ve already established this link together. Liam: Caleb is my awful horrible character. He’s selfish and The Worst ! 
Me: Last episode he admitted to Beau that he missed...

summary: One of the funniest things to me is that, canonically, Caleb and Yasha are almost the same height; Liam’s said Caleb is 5″10,...
body: One of the funniest things to me is that, canonically, Caleb and Yasha are almost the same height; Liam’s said Caleb is 5″10, and Ashley said early on that Yasha’s 5″11-ish. But we all just… ignored it so hard that that’s inconceivable for most of the fandom. It doesn’t even occur to us to show Yasha as the same size as Caleb.

reblog.comment: One of the funniest things to me is that, canonically, Caleb and Yasha are almost the same height; Liam’s said Caleb is 5″10, and Ashley said early on that Yasha’s 5″11-ish. But we all just… ignored it so hard that that’s inconceivable for most of the fandom. It doesn’t even occur to us to show Yasha as the same size as Caleb.

trail.content_raw: One of the funniest things to me is that, canonically, Caleb and Yasha are almost the same height; Liam’s said Caleb is 5″10, and Ashley said early on that Yasha’s 5″11-ish. But we all just… ignored it so hard that that’s inconceivable for most of the fandom. It doesn’t even occur to us to show Yasha as the same size as Caleb.
trail.content: One of the funniest things to me is that, canonically, Caleb and Yasha are almost the same height; Liam’s said Caleb is 5″10, and Ashley said early on that Yasha’s 5″11-ish. But we all just… ignored it so hard that that’s inconceivable for most of the fandom. It doesn’t even occur to us to show Yasha as the same size as Caleb.
